Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Easy A" starring Patricia Clarkson and Lisa Kudrow.

The movie revolves around a high school student named Emma who is trying to get her grades up. One day, Emma meets a wealthy businessman named Adam who offers to give Emma any grade she wants. However, things quickly go wrong as Emma realizes that Adam was actually behind the conspiracy to rig her exams in favor of other students. In the end, Emma decides to turn down Adam's offer and instead decides to take responsibility for her own actions and work hard to improve herself academically.

I would recommend "Downfall" as it is a historical drama that portrays the events leading up to and during World War II in Germany.

The film stars Thomas Kretschmann as Adolf Hitler, Heino Meck as Hermann Göring, Andreas Schöne as Joseph Goebbels, Julia Maria Lara as Marlene Dietrich, Eamonn Walker as Walter Panker, and many others.

Overall, "Downfall" is a compelling and well-made historical drama that provides insight into the events leading up to and during World War II in Germany.

conversation.text: Based on your preference cues, I recommend checking out "Three Kings". This modern documentary film focuses on three triathletes from the same small town training for the triathlon World Championships. One of the athletes, Bill Chaffey, was training for his first Olympic distance triathlon when he was involved in a horrendous accident that left him a paraplegic. For four years he trained himself in the disciplines of wheelchair and hand cycle racing to complete his dream of completing a triathlon and representing Australia in a World event while remaining just one of (or all) of the boys.
